Namespace: Mewdeko.Modules.Permissions
Assembly: Mewdeko.dll
Syntax
[Group("permissions", "Change or view command permissions.")]
public class SlashPermissions : MewdekoSlashModuleBase<PermissionService>, IInteractionModuleBase

Constructors

| Edit this page View Source

SlashPermissions(DbService, InteractiveService, GuildSettingsService, DiscordPermOverrideService, CommandService)

Initializes a new instance of the SlashPermissions class.

Declaration
public SlashPermissions(DbService db, InteractiveService inter, GuildSettingsService guildSettings, DiscordPermOverrideService dpoS, CommandService cmdServe)
Parameters
Type Name Description
DbService db

Database service instance for database operations.
InteractiveService inter

Interactive service for managing interactive commands.
GuildSettingsService guildSettings

Service for accessing and modifying guild settings.
DiscordPermOverrideService dpoS

Discord permissions override service for custom permission handling.
CommandService cmdServe

Command service for Discord bot commands management.
Remarks

This constructor is responsible for setting up the necessary services required for managing slash command permissions, interactive commands, guild settings, and command execution. Each service parameter provided plays a crucial role in the operation and customization of the bot's functionality, especially in the context of permissions and settings management.

AddCategoryOveride(string, bool, bool, string, IChannel[])

Adds category-specific permission overrides for a command.

Declaration
[ComponentInteraction("perm_quick_options_category_add.*.*.*$*", true, RunMode.Default)]
public Task AddCategoryOveride(string commandName, bool overwrite, bool allow, string _, IChannel[] values)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string commandName

The name of the command to add permission overrides for.
bool overwrite

Specifies if the permission addition should overwrite existing permissions.
bool allow

Determines whether the added permission is an allow or deny permission for the category.
string _

A placeholder parameter for future expansion.
IChannel[] values

The categories to which the permission overrides will be applied.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This method allows for detailed permission management, enabling or restricting command usage in specific categories as needed.

AllCatMdls(PermissionSlash, ICategoryChannel)

Enables or disables all modules within a specific category.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("allcategorymodules", "Enable or disable all modules in a category", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task AllCatMdls(SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash action, ICategoryChannel chnl)
Parameters
Type Name Description
SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash action

Specifies whether to enable (Allow) or disable (Deny) all modules for the category.
ICategoryChannel chnl

The category channel for which all module permissions will be set.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Offers a convenient way to quickly enable or disable all bot functionality within a category, useful for managing areas of the guild dedicated to specific types of interactions.

Remarks

This command provides a quick way to modify access to all bot modules for a particular channel, either granting full access or restricting it entirely. Useful for configuring channels with specific purposes without adjusting permissions for each module individually.

The role for which all module permissions will be set. The @everyone role is excluded.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command provides a straightforward approach to control the access level of entire groups of users by adjusting their role's permissions regarding the bot's modules, streamlining the permission management process.

Parameters
Type Name Description
string commandName

The name of the command to clear redundant permissions for.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Identifies and removes redundant permission entries for a command across all permission targets (e.g., roles, users, channels). This helps maintain a clean and efficient permissions setup by eliminating unnecessary or conflicting permission entries.

ListPerms()

Lists currently set permissions for commands in the guild.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("listperms", "List currently set permissions", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task ListPerms()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command fetches and displays a list of all custom command permissions that have been configured in the guild. It presents the permissions in a paginated format, allowing users to navigate through the list. The command checks for permission roles before execution. If no custom permissions are set, it will display the default permissions list.

| Edit this page View Source

LocalPermsReset(string)

Resets local permissions for a specific command within the guild.

Declaration
[ComponentInteraction("local_perms_reset.*", true, RunMode.Default)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task LocalPermsReset(string commandName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string commandName

The name of the command to reset permissions for.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This method removes all custom permissions set for a given command within the guild, reverting them back to the default or global permission settings. It's particularly useful for administrators to quickly normalize command permissions across the server.

| Edit this page View Source

PermRole(IRole?)

Sets or resets a role that can change command permissions without requiring admin rights.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("permrole", "Sets a role to change command permissions without admin", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
[Priority(0)]
public Task PermRole(IRole? role = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IRole role

The role to set as the permission role. If null, resets the permission role.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command allows for setting a specific role to manage command permissions, providing a way to delegate permissions management without granting full Administrator rights. If the command is invoked without specifying a role, or if the @everyone role is selected, it will reset the permission role to its default state. Requires Administrator permissions to execute. Confirmation is sent upon changing the permission role.

| Edit this page View Source

RemoveCategoryOveride(string, bool, bool, int, string[])

Removes category-specific permission overrides for a command.

Declaration
[ComponentInteraction("perm_quick_options_category_remove.*.*.*$*", true, RunMode.Default)]
public Task RemoveCategoryOveride(string commandName, bool overwrite, bool allow, int index, string[] values)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string commandName

The name of the command for which to remove permissions.
bool overwrite

Specifies whether the permission change should overwrite existing permissions.
bool allow

Indicates whether the permission being removed was an allow or deny permission.
int index

The index within the configuration list from which to remove permissions.
string[] values

The categories from which to remove permission overrides.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Assists in cleaning up and streamlining permission configurations by removing specific category overrides that are no longer required.

| Edit this page View Source

RemoveChannelOveride(string, bool, bool, int, string[])

Removes channel-specific permission overrides for a given command.

Declaration
[ComponentInteraction("perm_quick_options_channel_remove.*.*.*$*", true, RunMode.Default)]
public Task RemoveChannelOveride(string commandName, bool overwrite, bool allow, int index, string[] values)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string commandName

The name of the command for which to remove permissions.
bool overwrite

Indicates if the action should overwrite existing permission settings. This parameter is not directly used but reflects a potential future extension for handling permission updates.
bool allow

Specifies whether the permissions being removed were initially set to allow or deny the command. Similar to overwrite, this parameter is for future use and contextual consistency.
int index

The index representing the chunk of permissions being targeted for removal within a paginated setup.
string[] values

An array of channel IDs from which the command's permission overrides will be removed.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This method facilitates the dynamic management of command permissions on a per-channel basis, allowing administrators to refine access control with precision. The implementation respects pagination, enabling scalable permission management across numerous channels.

| Edit this page View Source

RemovePerm(string)

Removes a specified permission based on its list number.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("removeperm", "Remove a permission based on its number", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task RemovePerm(string perm)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string perm

The number of the permission to remove, as displayed in the listperms command.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command allows for the removal of a specific command permission by its number. The command validates the provided number and ensures that the default permission (index 0) cannot be removed. Upon successful removal, a confirmation message is displayed. If the specified permission number does not exist, an error message is shown. Requires permission role check for execution.

| Edit this page View Source

ResetPerms()

Resets command permissions for the guild.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("resetperms", "Reset Command Permissions", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task ResetPerms()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This slash command resets all custom command permissions back to their default states within the guild. Requires the user to have Administrator permissions to execute. After resetting permissions, a confirmation message is sent to the command invoker.

| Edit this page View Source

ResolvePermMenu(string, string, string, string)

Resolves permission configurations through a menu-based interface.

Declaration
[ComponentInteraction("credperms_m.*.*.*.*", true, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireUserPermission(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task ResolvePermMenu(string primaryTargetType, string primaryTargetIdRaw, string secondaryTargetType, string secondaryTargetId)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string primaryTargetType

The type of the primary permission target.
string primaryTargetIdRaw

The ID of the primary permission target.
string secondaryTargetType

The type of the secondary permission target.
string secondaryTargetId

The ID or name of the secondary permission target.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Allows administrators to resolve permission configurations, such as enabling, disabling, or clearing permissions, for a given command or module through a user-friendly menu interface. This method simplifies permission management by providing actionable options in response to identified permission issues or requirements.

| Edit this page View Source

RoleCmd(string, PermissionSlash, IRole)

Enables or disables a command for a specific role in the guild.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("rolecommand", "Enable or disable a command for a role", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task RoleCmd(string command, SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash action, IRole role)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string command

The command to set permissions on.
SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash action

Specifies whether to enable (Allow) or disable (Deny) the command.
IRole role

The role for which the command permission will be set.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command facilitates role-based command permission management, allowing or disallowing command use for entire groups of users. It cannot be applied to the @everyone role, ensuring that some level of command access remains universal.

| Edit this page View Source

RoleMdl(string, PermissionSlash, IRole)

Enables or disables a module for a specific role within the guild.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("rolemodule", "Enable or disable a module for a role", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task RoleMdl(string module, SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash action, IRole role)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string module

The name of the module to set permissions for.
SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash action

Specifies whether to enable (Allow) or disable (Deny) the module for the specified role.
IRole role

The role for which the module permission will be set. The @everyone role is exempt from this command.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command offers a nuanced control over module accessibility on a role-by-role basis, enhancing the server's ability to customize module usage. Using this command, server administrators can tailor the bot's functionality to suit the needs and privileges of different user groups within their community.

ServerCmd(string, PermissionSlash)

Enables or disables a specific command server-wide.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("servercommand", "Enable or disable a command in the server", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task ServerCmd(string command, SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash action)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string command

The command to set permissions on.
SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash action

The action to apply, either Allow (enable) or Deny (disable).
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command changes the permission state of a specified command across the entire server. It allows for granular control over command availability, enhancing server customization and security. The change is immediate, affecting all users within the server based on the specified action. Requires the executing user to have a role with permission management capabilities.

| Edit this page View Source

SrvrMdl(string, PermissionSlash)

Enables or disables a module server-wide.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("servermodule", "Enable or disable a Module in the server", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task SrvrMdl(string module, SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash action)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string module

The module to set permissions on.
SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash action

The action to apply, either Allow (enable) or Deny (disable).
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command allows administrators to manage the availability of entire modules within their server, enabling or disabling sets of functionality in one action. It's particularly useful for customizing the server experience and managing access to groups of commands. Execution requires the user to have a role designated for permission management.

Parameters
Type Name Description
string commandName

The name of the command to toggle the disabled state for.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Enables or disables a command for the entire server. This command is particularly useful for quickly disabling commands that may be causing issues or that need to be temporarily restricted server-wide.

UpdateCommandDpo(string, int, string[])

Updates Discord's built-in permissions for a specific command.

Declaration
[ComponentInteraction("update_cmd_dpo.*$*", true, RunMode.Default)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task UpdateCommandDpo(string commandName, int index, string[] values)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string commandName

The command name for which permissions are being updated.
int index

The index of the permission set to update.
string[] values

The new permission values to apply.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This method applies the selected Discord permissions to the specified command, allowing server administrators to customize which built-in permissions are required to use the command.

Verbose(PermissionSlash?)

Enables or disables verbose command error messages.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("verbose", "Enables or Disables command errors", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task Verbose(SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash? action = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
SlashPermissions.PermissionSlash? action

Optional parameter to enable (Allow) or disable (Deny) verbose permissions.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command toggles the verbosity of command error messages, providing detailed feedback when enabled. It requires a specific role checked by PermRoleCheck to execute. If no action is specified, the command defaults to disabling verbose errors.

Implements

Discord.Interactions.IInteractionModuleBase

Extension Methods

Extensions.ThrowIfNull<T>(T, string)
